state_summary: Ben Sanders launched his emergency response startup Hyper, which announced a $6.3 million seed round led by Eniac Ventures and emerged from stealth. The company uses AI to handle non-emergency calls to 911 services.
evidence: Sanders had his mother sew yellow stripes on his navy sweatpants as a child because he wanted to become a police officer
He read an article about using AI to reduce wait time for emergency services in his hometown, which sparked the idea for Hyper
The company's product can handle some 911 calls and is focused on dealing with non-emergency calls that take time away from critical calls
Hyper has already gone live with many centers and supports more languages
